chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)
Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven M Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challeng Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 108 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Ozaukee County Case 14CF286.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution of $922.44 is payable to Bank One Mutual.  To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Steven M Patterson in court, in custody (OTP's from Oshkosh Correctional), with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Counts 1 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.

Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  4 Years.
Initial Confinement:  18 Months.
Extended Supervision:  30 Months
108 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Present Sentence (Ozaukee County Case:  14CF286).


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victims listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

RESTITUTION:  $922.44 (to be paid to Bank One Mutual - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and SURCHARGE:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defense is requesting that the $252.07 held in his seized property (Held by City of Brookfield P.D.) be applied to the restitution.
Court order thoses monies being held by City of Brookfield P.D.be turned over to D.O.C. to be applied to the restitution.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Defendant to be returned to  - Oshkosh Correctional - FORTHWITH.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Case not called on the record.  Defense requests short adjournment due to the late hour this morning.  Court orders defendant to remain in custody at Waukesha County pending further order of the Court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
